image.altText: Aerial view of roads in mountains

props.synopsis: Donald Trump confirms the US has struck three Iranian nuclear facilities, joining Israel's air campaign. Follow live.

title.children: US attacks Iran

image.altText: A baby girl in a pink jumpsuit

props.synopsis: The mother of a seven-month-old girl with a congenital heart condition who died at Royal Darwin Hospital after waiting nine hours to see a doctor is suing the hospital for negligence.

title.children: Mother whose baby died after nine-hour wait for help sues Darwin hospital

image.altText: A large piece of equipment on the port.

props.synopsis: The founder of two major new marine infrastructure projects in Western Australia is weighing up a bid for the Darwin Port.

title.children: Australian business considering bid for embattled Darwin Port

image.altText: Wooden sculptures standing inside an art gallery.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of traditional artworks, connecting generations of remote First Nations communities for almost a century, are now part of a public showcase in Sydney.

title.children: Art reflects First Nations' worldview in hopes of shared understanding

image.altText: A collection of beanies displayed on a wall.

props.synopsis: An intricate hot air balloon beanie and a woolly hat made entirely from dog fur are among the almost 7,000 creations on display at this year's Alice Springs Beanie Festival.

title.children: In the outback, 7,000 beanies — and one made of dog fur — are stealing the show

image.altText: Land clearing NSW

props.synopsis: Investigations are under way into satellite images the Australian Conservation Foundation says are proof farmers across Australia have illegally cleared 900 square kilometres of native habitat in five years.

title.children: Conservation group compiles 'shocking' evidence of mass habitat loss

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Labor’s timidity may finally be evaporating but the backlash over tax reform is coming and it could get ugly.

title.children: 'Boomers beware' threat won't cut it as government opens door to tax reforms

image.altText: A sign for the Youth Court in Adelaide

props.synopsis: A program allowing young drug-dependent South Australians to be detained against their will for treatment should be scrapped, a government review has been told.

title.children: Calls to ditch 'expensive experiment' on drug-dependent children amid government review

image.altText: Mid shot of Rachael Gunn wearing Olympic uniform, blurred out crowd behind, pulling face and throwing hands forward.

props.synopsis: There's an elite club of Olympic losers who we love to celebrate. A year on from Raygun's infamous performance, Australian Story investigates why she isn't one of them.

title.children: Australia loves an underdog, so why did it all go so wrong for Raygun?

image.altText: Todd Payten, North Queensland Cowboys coach

props.synopsis: North Queensland Cowboys coach Todd Payten has said his team were "bullied" following a second consecutive trashing in the NRL.

title.children: 'Men against boys': Cowboys coach says changes will be considered after another big loss

image.altText: GettyImages-2168322957

props.synopsis: Matt Rowell has recommitted to the Suns for two years, turning down serious offers from Victorian clubs. His side fell to GWS in the expansion cup, while the Dogs dominated the Tigers.

title.children: Ugle-Hagan opens up about personal struggles, Rowell recommits to the Suns

image.altText: A man with short hair and a tshirt poses solemnly for a photo, with a pair of black sunglasses on the top of his head.

props.synopsis: In 2023, Clint's partner died by suicide the day after being discharged after a previous attempt. He's worried the system still hasn't changed.

title.children: 20 months after his partner's death, has NSW's mental health system improved?

image.altText: David Janetzki wearing a suit and glasses looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Treasurer David Janetzki is due to deliver the LNP state government's first budget on Tuesday.

title.children: Queensland treasurer promises targeted cost-of-living relief in first budget

image.altText: A teenage boy sitting in a tractor cab smiling.

props.synopsis: In the New South Wales Riverina, delayed autumn rain threw winter sowing programs off kilter, but teenagers Declan and Brianna Dennis are helping get things back on track on their family farm.

title.children: He's 13 and farming hundreds of hectares in the Riverina

image.altText: An artist render of a concrete building surrounded by grassland.

props.synopsis: A waste incinerator designed to burn 400,000 tonnes of rubbish a year is proposed for Lara, an area in the outskirts of Geelong. Locals vehemently oppose the project on environmental grounds and because of a lack of information about who will build it.

title.children: From Jiangsu to Geelong: The Chinese state connections behind Lara's waste incinerator

image.altText: three now deceased israeli hostages, two men and a woman in the middle of a composite image

props.synopsis: The hostages were identified as civilians 71-year-old Ofra Keidar, 21-year-old Yonatan Samerano, and 19-year old soldier Shay Levinson.

title.children: Israel says it's recovered bodies of three more hostages from Gaza

image.altText: A woman with a paintball gun in her hand turns to look at the camera.

props.synopsis: As Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine rages into its fourth year, Poland is preparing to be the Russian president's next target, beefing up defences on its borders and making every man a "fully fledged" soldier.

title.children: 'Try to bite us, they'll break their teeth': Poland ready for Putin

image.altText: Mahmoud Khalil pushes a pram towards the camera with an arm around his wife Noor Abdalla

props.synopsis: Palestinian rights activist Mahmoud Khalil says he will continue to protest against what he calls US government-funded genocide in Gaza.

title.children: Mahmoud Khalil vows to resume pro-Palestinian activism after release

image.altText: A man with a heavily tattooed face and a Chanel Number 5 jumper stands with his hands in his pocket.

props.synopsis: Michael Farrelly promised his clients he'd send their sex drive "through the roof". But almost a decade after he was first investigated for medical fraud, authorities have finally closed in on him.

title.children: Testosterone salesman promising 'through-the-roof sex drive' banned

image.altText: An aerial view of islands around Raja Ampat in east Indonesia's West Papua region

props.synopsis: A pristine archipelago off Indonesia's east coast emerges as the latest battleground between conservationists and the government, who are at odds over the country's nickel industry.

title.children: 'The last paradise' mined for nickel in Indonesia

image.altText: A man in a brown jumper with a thoughtful expression stands in front of a river with rock cliffs rising above it

props.synopsis: In the time since I have disappeared from our television screens, I have spent more time back here in this valley, in the land of my ancestors.

title.children: I disappeared off TV screens seeking a different life. Here's what I found

image.altText: A bearded man in a navy hoodie leans over a patient with a stethoscope

props.synopsis: When there are systemic problems, shortages of staff, lack of money, insufficient organ donors, delays in treatment, and over-burdened medical systems with long wait times in or out of emergency systems, doctors and nurses can feel it deeply.

title.children: The Pitt is no fiction: Our doctors and nurses are grappling with a moral crisis

image.altText: CCTV footage of a shooting in an Auburn kebab shop

props.synopsis: Teens are joining Sydney's underworld war, but their biggest threat isn't the legal system — it's becoming a target themselves.

title.children: A message and then a shooting: Teens lured into gangland war

image.altText: Man reads book in a hospital bed with tube in his nose.

props.synopsis: Tom Zdanius suffered a stroke in Japan last month and has been lying in bed, racking up medical bills of about $5,000 a day ever since.

title.children: Australian man stranded in Japan as stroke leaves him with $130K bill

image.altText: Aerial view of burnt pine forests.

props.synopsis: Bushfires and a lack of seed have created a "ticking time bomb" in Victoria's alpine and mountain ash forests, scientists are warning.

title.children: How the timber industry shutdown has endangered mountain forests

image.altText: A sad bulldog on a pink background.

props.synopsis: Dogs are increasingly being prescribed medications to treat "problem behaviours", but experts suggest non-drug solutions could be better.

title.children: As more dogs end up on antidepressants, some vets raise alarm

image.altText: mum holds baby in kitchen as dad stands behind

props.synopsis: While fathers are becoming increasingly engaged in daily family life, the persistence of a gendered norm means some feel on the "outskirts" when it comes to parenting decisions.

title.children: 'Passenger parenting' leaves dads on backfoot and mums carrying the load

image.altText: Inside the dome of a space observatory looking upwards at a night sky from a large blue telescope cradle.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have been waiting for the Vera C Rubin Observatory to open for 30 years. So what is it, and how will it change astronomy?

title.children: World's 'biggest digital camera' about to transform our view of the sky

image.altText: A red and white passenger ferry docked in a bay with the blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: The newest Spirit of Tasmania ship is finally set to leave Europe and start heading to Tasmania in just over a week.

title.children: One delayed Spirit of Tasmania ship to arrive in August, premier says

image.altText: A man and a child armed with bows and arrows run through a forest

props.synopsis: In 2002, Danny Boyle and Alex Garland started a zombie frenzy. Decades later, the duo have reunited to show the human cost of an infected apocalypse.

title.children: Why Danny Boyle filmed 28 Years Later on 20 iPhones

image.altText: A man in a dark blue uniform crouches as he looks at a pile of twisted metal debris lying among trees.

props.synopsis: A hot air balloon carrying 21 passengers catches fire in southern Brazil, falling from the sky and killing eight of the people on board.

title.children: Hot air balloon catches fire and crashes in Brazil, killing eight

image.altText: Sunshine Coast Falcons rugby league player James Ackerman, date unknown.

props.synopsis: Rugby league player James Ackerman was 25 when his death from a shoulder charge shattered his family, his club and his Sunshine Coast community. On Sunday, they honour his legacy and a life lived "the Ackers way".

title.children: Honouring 'Ackers', 10 years after a fatal on-field collision

image.altText: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan reacts after Victorian Treasurer Jaclyn Symes deliver state budget

props.synopsis: The government says tens of thousands of businesses will pay less tax under changes being introduced next month.

title.children: Victoria to cut payroll tax and red tape amid surging debt

image.altText: a photo of a man with brown eyes and short shaved hair

props.synopsis: Authorities locate missing man Glenn Courtis after his car was found in Childers on Friday.

title.children: Queensland man found after abandoned car sparked search

image.altText: Woman and her dog at an RSPCA centre

props.synopsis: Shelters in the ACT are on the brink after cost of living pressures are causing deformed pups to be euthanised.

title.children: Backyard breeders on notice after 'deformed' puppies euthanised
